timeline.message:
HHH-13925 Upgrade from the gradle-build-scan plugin to the gradle-enterprise plugin

That's the new name of the plugin in Gradle 6.
HHH-13925 Disable Gradle module metadata publishing until we know what we want

HHH-13925 Fix invalid javadoc syntax

This wasn't detected by checkstyle in Gradle 5, but it is now, and that
fails the build.

HHH-13925 Fix malformed @author tags in javadoc

You're not supposed to use unescaped "<" or ">".

This wasn't detected by checkstyle in Gradle 5, but it is now, and that
fails the build.

replies.bodyText: If you want to leave it as Apache, that's fine too.  I just mean the style
replies.author: sebersole

replies.bodyText: I did not add these copyright headers, the Gradle Wrapper plugin did, automatically, when I upgraded. It's code from the Gradle Wrapper plugin, and I do not feel comfortable about changing either the license or the copyright holders.
replies.author: yrodiere

replies.bodyText: Besides, this file will be replaced automatically each time we upgrade to a newer Gradle version.
replies.author: yrodiere

replies.bodyText: This is something new they have added then.  It is clearly new additions (new lines).  I just assumed you added them.  No problem then
